put.summary: Refresh an existing emarking distribution with late submissions
put.description:
## Description

The endpoint processes late student exercise submissions and updates the emarking distribution associated to the exercise accordingly.
The resulting single-file submissions are allocated to the indicated markers randomly (if no manual allocation configuration is provided).
The existing distribution's parameters are preserved, including target files and the optional blank page.


## Params

* **markers** (xor with **allocations**): list of (usernames of) markers among which to allocate the collated submissions; the allocation is random and produces equally-sized marking batches.
* **allocations** (xor with **markers**): a manual allocation object with student username key and marker username value e.g. *{'hpotter': 'adumble', 'rweasley': 'adumble', 'dmalfoy': 'ssnape'}*. If this is set, 'markers' is ignored.


## Access
Module staff only

Note that submissions associated to the group are **not** deleted.

patch.summary: Respond to a submission group invitation
patch.description:
## Description

This endpoint finalises a response to a submission group membership invitation. The response is
determined by the value of the  **accepted** boolean query parameter.

get.description:
## Description

This endpoint returns a user-specific summary of all the available exercises relevant to the user, inclusive of deadline extension, mark and feedback (if any is available), the history of submissions and workload survey response.
The history of submissions takes into account the case of individual submissions as well as group submissions.

## Description

This endpoint returns a user-specific summary of the exercise, inclusive of deadline extension, mark and feedback (if any is available), the history of submissions and workload survey response.
The history of submissions takes into account the case of individual submissions as well as group submissions.

get.description:
## Description
The endpoint computes the consolidation of marks for each module and student specified in the configuration.
Grouping of modules is possible by specifying the grouping conditions in the dedicated optional sub-configuration.
Grouped modules are assumed to have matching **students** attributes in the configuration.


## Params

* **modules_to_consolidate** (required): a list of module objects to consolidate. Each object must be structured as follows:
    * **module_code** (required): code of the module to consolidate
    * **students** (required): list of usernames of the students to consolidate CW marks for
* **groupings** (optional): list of grouping objects to create *meta* modules for aggregated consolidation of other module components (e.g. 50007.1 and 50007.2). Each grouping must be structured as follows:
    * **label** (required): the label for the grouping
    * **contributions** (required): list of contribution objects, each comprising **module_code** and a numerical **contribution**. The sum of all contributions in the same grouping must be 100.


## Access
Year coordinators only
Retrieves exercises for all modules a student is in

post.description:
## Description

The endpoint processes student submissions to produce a single PDF per student on a best-effort basis.
The resulting single-file submissions are then allocated to the provided markers. We call the outcome of this process 'emarking distribution'.
If the indicated exercise is configured to accept no submissions by students (i.e. has no deliverables), the emarking distribution can still be created, with
the difference that the per-student artifacts do not point to a file.


## Params

* **platform** (required): 'labts' if the exercise' deliverables include a git hash submitted via LabTS; 'scientia' otherwise.
* **target_files** (optional): a space-separated list of deliverable file names to cherry-pick for the collation; leave empty or null to collate all the available files.
* **markers** (xor with **allocations**): list of (usernames of) markers among which to allocate the collated submissions; the allocation is random and produces equally-sized marking batches.
* **allocations** (xor with **markers**): a manual allocation object with student username key and marker username value e.g. *{'hpotter': 'adumble', 'rweasley': 'adumble', 'dmalfoy': 'ssnape'}*. If this is set, 'markers' is ignored.
* **add_blank_page** (optional): a boolean indicating whether to prepend a blank page to each collated submission.


## Access
Module staff only
